name: Modules.SafariDialog
summary: Allows a Titanium application to use the iOS Safari ViewController to create an embedded browser.

deprecated.notes: This module has been deprecated in favor of the cross-platform module Ti.WebDialog that shares full backwards compatibility with Ti.SafariDialog on iOS

events.name: open
events.summary: The open event is fired after the Safari dialog has opened.

properties.name: url
properties.summary: The URL provided when opening the Safari dialog

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: True if the event will try to bubble up if possible.

properties.name: cancelBubble
properties.summary: Set to true to stop the event from bubbling.

events.name: close
events.summary: The close event is fired when the Safari dialog is closed by the user or programmatically.

properties.name: url
properties.summary: The URL provided when opening the Safari dialog

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: True if the event will try to bubble up if possible.

properties.name: cancelBubble
properties.summary: Set to true to stop the event from bubbling.

events.name: load
events.summary: Fired when the initial URL load is complete.
events.description:
This event is invoked when the safari dialog completes the loading of the URL that you pass to it's initializer. It is not invoked for any subsequent page loads in the same safari dialog instance.

Note: This event is available in Titanium SDK 6.0.0 and later.

properties.name: url
properties.summary: The URL provided when opening the Safari dialog

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: True if the event will try to bubble up if possible.

properties.name: cancelBubble
properties.summary: Set to true to stop the event from bubbling.

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.summary: Properties to set on a new object, including any defined by Modules.SafariDialog.AuthenticationSession except those marked not-creation or read-only.

methods.name: open
methods.summary: Opens the SafariDialog with the options provided.
methods.description: var dialog = require('ti.safaridialog'); if (dialog.isSupported()) { dialog.open({ url: 'http://appcelerator.com', title: 'Hello World', tintColor: 'red' }); }

parameters.name: params
parameters.summary: Dictionary used to configure the Safari dialog.

constants.name: DISMISS_BUTTON_STYLE_CANCEL
constants.summary: Button style used to display a localized "Cancel" button.

constants.name: DISMISS_BUTTON_STYLE_CLOSE
constants.summary: Button style used to display a localized "Close" button.

constants.name: DISMISS_BUTTON_STYLE_DONE
constants.summary: Button style used to display a localized "Done" button.
